metadata.title: CVE-2019-5786 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Object lifetime issue in Blink in Google Chrome prior to 72.0.3626.121allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of bounds memoryaccess via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.3626.121-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
